content: Buttons are used for actions. They can be styled with various props, including `size`, `radius`, `color`, and `variant` (solid, bordered, light, flat, faded, shadow, ghost).
A button can be set to a disabled state with the `isDisabled` prop. A loading state can be activated with `isLoading`, which displays a spinner. The spinner itself can be a custom component.
Icons can be added to the start or end of a button using the `startContent` and `endContent` props. To create a button that only contains an icon, use the `isIconOnly` prop.
The `ButtonGroup` component is used to group multiple buttons together. You can apply props like `isDisabled` to the group to affect all buttons within it.
For advanced customization, you can use the `useButton` hook to create your own button component from scratch, while retaining the core logic and accessibility features.
The Button component has a `role` of `button` and supports keyboard events (Space, Enter), focus management, and press states for full accessibility.
